comments.author: fourstar10_2000@yahoo.com
comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux x86_64; en-US) AppleWebKit/534.13 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/9.0.597.84 Safari/534.13
Build Identifier: Gentoo

Thunderbird 3.1.7
Lightning 1.0b3pre

many many "Item changed on server" dialogs opening. Problem is "Submit my changes" button should be ghosted because it is a read only calendar. And then, "An error has occured" dialog -> trying to write to a "read-only" calender... It is read-only! Lightning should not be trying to write to it. 

Reproducible: Always




A dialog - "Some Items have changed on the server" Do you want to update your local calendar? (yes) (no)
comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux x86_64; en-US) AppleWebKit/534.13 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/9.0.597.84 Safari/534.13
Build Identifier: Gentoo

Thunderbird 3.1.7
Lightning 1.0b3pre

many many "Item changed on server" dialogs opening. Problem is "Submit my changes" button should be ghosted because it is a read only calendar. And then, "An error has occured" dialog -> trying to write to a "read-only" calender... It is read-only! Lightning should not be trying to write to it. 

Reproducible: Always




A dialog - "Some Items have changed on the server" Do you want to update your local calendar? (yes) (no)

comments.author: ssitter@gmail.com
comments.creator: ssitter@gmail.com
comments.raw_text: Please provide detailed steps that can be used to reproduce the problem.
comments.text: Please provide detailed steps that can be used to reproduce the problem.

comments.author: fourstar10_2000@yahoo.com
comments.creator: fourstar10_2000@yahoo.com
comments.text: I start up thunderbird, and all these "Item changed on server" dialogs open. There were changes made on the exchange server during the time thunderbird was off.
comments.raw_text: I start up thunderbird, and all these "Item changed on server" dialogs open. There were changes made on the exchange server during the time thunderbird was off.
